quotes.quote: What we find in a soulmate is not something wild to tame but something wild to run with.
Our soulmate is the one who makes life come to life.
The idea of a soulmate is beautiful and very romantic to talk about it in a movie or a song, but in reality, I find it scary.
Someone who loves you will reveal beautiful things within yourself... things you had never noticed before... things nobody else cared to.
Our souls already know each other, don't they?' he whispered. 'It's our bodies that are new.
Your soulmate will always find you, be it in this life or the next.
Have you ever felt really close to someone? So close that you can't understand why you and the other person have two separate bodies, two separate skins?
In a soulmate we find not company but a completed solitude.
A soulmate is the person who makes your soul grow the most.
A bond between souls is ancient-older than the planet.
You have half our gifts. I the other. Together we make a whole. Together we are much more powerful.
A soulmate is the one person whose love is powerful enough to motivate you to meet your soul, to do the emotional work of self-discovery, of awakening.
Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.

A soulmate is someone to whom we feel profoundly connected, as though the communicating and communing that take place between us were not the product of intentional efforts, but rather a divine grace.
Your soulmate doesn't just mean your husband or your boyfriend. I have friends in my life who I believe I was meant to meet and be a part of.
Our soulmate is someone who shares our deepest longings, our sense of direction. When we're two balloons, and together our direction is up, chances are we've found the right person.
There is a special bond between twin soul mates--unconditional love, respect for each other, bringing out the best in each other, and highly compatible.
the soul mate doesn't have to be in a romantic relationship. Sometimes in life, you meet people when you need them, and there is an immediate connection.
One does not find soulmates.. soulmates  happen' unannounced in some turn of this deliciously unpredictable journey called life, often when we are not even  groomed for the occasion.
Sometimes, soulmates may meet, stay together until a task or life lesson is completed, and then move on. This is not a tragedy, only a matter of learning.
You will not find a soulmate in the quiet of your room. You must go to a noisy place and look in the quiet corners.
The first thing you should know is that soulmates are real. They are not just some romantic idea. We are made for one person and one person alone.
In all the world, there is no heart for me like yours. In all the world, there is no love for you like mine.
A soul mate is... someone whose way of viewing life is not necessarily the same as yours but complements yours... there is not a compromise, there is a complement.
The soulmate is what we aspire to and like to understand about ourself, is what we deem to be perfection, purity, and endless love.
When deep down in the core of your being you believe that your soulmate exists, there is no limit to the ways he or she can enter your life.
The soulmate bond goes beyond 'Til death do us part': for true love never dies.
Our soulmates seldom appeal to our personality   our ego. That's why they are called soulmates rather than egomates.
If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. And if they don't, they never were.
Grow old with me, the best is yet to be.
